title: 111_s3338
content: The Act titled "Advanced Biofuel Investment Act of 2010" provides an investment tax credit for qualified advanced biofuel production property. The Act "Advanced Biofuel Investment Act of 2010" introduces a tax credit for qualified advanced biofuel production property under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Act "Advanced Biofuel Investment Act of 2010" offers a tax credit for qualified advanced biofuel production property, which is used in projects certified by the Secretary of Energy to produce advanced biofuels for sale to unrelated parties. The Act "Advanced Biofuel Investment Act of 2010" provides tax credits for advanced biofuel production property meeting Clean Air Act requirements and using new technologies. Additional requirements may be set by the Secretary of Energy. The objectives of this section aim to encourage private investment in projects with the greatest impact in reducing air pollutants and greenhouse gases, promoting commercial use of new technologies and fuel production processes. Rules and regulations will be issued by the Secretary of Energy. The Secretary of Energy will issue regulations for qualified advanced biofuel production property within 120 days of enactment. The term does not include property placed in service after December 31, 2014. Grants in lieu of tax credit are available for such properties. The Act is amended to allow for reinvestment of grants for specified energy property. Grants for such property must be reinvested within 12 months. Certain grants are exempt from being included in income. The amendments made by this section have an effective date. The amendments made by this section have an effective date for periods after the enactment of the Act, applying to taxable years ending after that date.
